quests.name: Next Level Ray Absorption
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel III! It can generate 32 RF/tick. Finally a respectable amount.

quests.name: Not quite straight
quests.description: Crush some organic materials into Biofuel, then infuse it with Water and Hydrogen to create some Substrate and Ethylene! You can use more Ethylene to multiply your Substrate.

quests.name: ...when you place it down!
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel VIII! It's capable of generating a massive 32,768 RF/tick! It's almost like an Extreme Reactor in a singular block!

quests.name: A subtle massacre
quests.description: Craft a Mob Slaughter Factory! Provide it with power, and use it to kill mobs from your Mob Farm or Animal Farm! This machine will produce Liquid Meat and Liquid Pink Slime in the process. Make sure to export both liquids. This can be done from a single side, through a Fluiduct or Fluid Conduit of sorts.

quests.name: All in one
quests.description: Craft a Material StoneWork Factory! This machine can easily create some various basic materials, and it's the perfect way to automate them. Simply lookup its capabilities in JEI, and setup multiple of them for easy automation!

quests.name: With a Spider's vision
quests.description: Craft an Amplification Crystal! It is used to... amplify stuff...! What did you think it was used for?!

quests.name: Liquidically
quests.description: Craft a Shape Card: Pump! With this, you can use your Builder to drain liquids just like any other Pump would do.

quests.name: Brighten up
quests.description: Craft 4 QuantumFlux Gold Casings! This is the base for all QuantumFlux machines.

quests.name: Wireless Industry
quests.description: Craft an Energy Field Provider! Craft more Energy Field Addons for machines you want to charge wirelessly. Simply Shift+Right Click an Energy Field Addon onto the Priovider, then input it into any machine that requires charging. The Provider will charge the machines with the rate of 512 RF/tick, and its range is 7x4x7 around the machine, which can be expanded with Range Addons.

quests.name: Zwoom! - goes the matter
quests.description: Craft some Matter Beamers for your RFTools Spawner to work. Link them to the spawner itself with any of the available wrenches. Provide items into your Matter Beamers that send them to your Spawner. The more Beamers, the faster the Spawner functions.

quests.name: Dreading for some light
quests.description:
Craft a Dread Lamp! You'll need a full OpenBlocks Tank of Tectonic Petrotheum.

This block prevents passive mobs from spawning in a 64 block radious. It WON'T prevent artificial spawning like Mob Spawners.

quests.name: No leakage
quests.description: Craft a Basic Gas Tank! It can store 64 Buckets of a single type of Gas.

quests.name: Even shinier! Even brighter!
quests.description: Pulverize some Industrial Grade Graphite Ores into Graphite Dust. Then blow up a stack of Graphite Dust to obtain some Hyper Diamonds!

quests.name: No Pressure though
quests.description: Craft a Mekanism Pressurized Reaction Chamber! It takes 1 Fluid input, 1 Gas input and and 1 Item input to create other Gases and Items. You'll also need to provide it with power, and the back side is the only one that can accept Liquids, so use all sides wisely!

quests.name: Frying the Dragons
quests.description: Craft a Wyvern Solar Panel! It can generate 65,536 RF/tick. Holy macaroni!

quests.name: Stiffen up
quests.description: Craft an RFTools Machine Frame! This is base for all RFTools Machines.

quests.name: Better Plastic creation
quests.description: Make a Tree Fluid Extractor and a Latex Processing Unit! Simply tap any type of Tree with the Extractor and send the fluid Latex into the Latex Processing Unit! It'll create Tiny Dry Rubber which you can easily process into Plastic. You'll need to automatically place logs in front of the Tree Fluid Extractor (using like a Block Placer), since it'll eat up the log eventually. Setup multiple of these machines for faster gain!

quests.name: Exactly like Plastic!
quests.description: Create some Plastic Sheets either by crafting, or in the Enrichment Chamber (the latter is preferrable, as it's much cheaper). Then use 4 Plastic Sheets and half a bucket of Nutrient Distillation (created in the EnderIO Vat) to create 1 Industrial Foregoing Plastic!

quests.name: Trees! Fall!
quests.description: Setup a Plant Gatherer to gather Saplings and a Plant Sower to plant them! These make up the perfect combination for an automated Tree Farm!

quests.name: Better than Emeralds
quests.description: Make a Quibit Crystal! Quibit - quibit!

quests.name: Don't think of its ingredients
quests.description: Create some Crystalline Pink Slime Ingots then alloy it further into some Crystalline Brown Slime Ingots!

quests.name: Grab every last photon!
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel V! It can generate a pretty good 512 RF/tick.

quests.name: Bouncy bouncy
quests.description:
Obtain at least 1 Bucket worth of Liquid Pink Slime! Make a small pen and dig out a 1x1 area to place your fluid into. After about a minute, the liquid will transform into a baby Pink Slime. Use looting on the cutie, or name it Jerry and keep it as your pet, or something. Your choice.

If you chose the first option, continue creating a Pink Slime Ingot.

quests.name: Engraved with 1's and 0's
quests.description: Craft an Advanced Circuit!

quests.name: Your first Spawner!
quests.description: Craft an RFTools Spawner! With this, you can automatically spawn some creatures into the world, though you'll need to pay a price. Note: Not all creatures can be spawned with this primitive block. You'll need Spawners from the following Chapters if you want to spawn other mobs. To use this one though, insert a Syringe of the specified mob, then the GUI will show you items that you need for the mob to spawn. If it shows "nullRF", the mob cannot be spawned unfortunately. You'll need to use Matter Beamers to provide the items. To connect the Matter Beamers, use a Crescent Hammer, a Yeta Wrench, or a Smart Wrench.

quests.name: Power cables are so 2010
quests.description: Craft an RF Entangler, an RF Exciter and 2 Exciter Upgrades! Place down the Entangler and provide power to it! Place some machines in the vacinity and place some RF Exciters on them! The Entangler is capable of powering all machines equipped with an Exciter as long as both of them are loaded! That's right, they can be any distance away! Applying Exciter Upgrades will increase the transfer rate by 100 RF/tick. Default transfer rate is also 100 RF/tick. Simply Shift+Right Click on the Exciter to apply the Upgrades.

quests.name: Block here, block there!
quests.description: Progress further into Ender Utilities, then craft a Matter Transporter from QuantumFlux! This tool is capable of transporting any non-unbreakable block from one location to the other. It's perfect for relocating Mob Spawners!

quests.name: Oxygen & Hydrogen!
quests.description: Craft an Electrolytic Separator! Use some kind of a pipe to import Water into the machine, and provide power to it as well. It will separate Water into Hydrogen and Oxygen. To transfer these gases, use Mekanism Pressurized Tubes. To store them, use Mekanism Gas Tanks. You can find quests for them to the right of this one.

quests.name: Don't get shocked!
quests.description: Craft a Mekanism Electrolytic Core! This is used as a crafting component is some machines.

quests.name: Craft, construct, assemble
quests.description: Make all 3 tiers of RFTools Crafters! Check back on this quest after each upgrade to see if the machine was detected or not. The RFTools Crafter is the bester external crafting machine, and you can easily set some up right now for items you need a lot of. Simply use an Export Bus with the crating ingredients and an Import Bus for the crafted materials. Don't worry, AE2 autocrafting will be here soon!

quests.name: Gas who it is!
quests.description: It's the Ultimate Gas Tank! Upgrade your Basic variant all the way to this! It can store 512 Buckets worth of Gas.

quests.name: Yeesh! Don't prick me...!
quests.description: Craft an RFTools Syringe! Left click on a specific type of mob multiple times to fill it up! Then you can insert it into the Spawner to automatically spawn a certain type of mob.

quests.name: 'Round and 'round
quests.description: Craft a Rotary Condensentator! This machine is capable of turning Gases into their Liquid variants or vice versa. Connect it to your power line and use Liquid/Gas cables and storage blocks for input/output.

quests.name: They say it gets darker...
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel VII! It generates 8,192 RF/tick. Better than a lot of other generators! :O

quests.name: Such a mean Zookeeper
quests.description:
Setup a automatic Cow or Pig farm with the machines listed on the right!

- Have a pen of some fully grown animals with an Animal Baby Separator on one of the walls. Use an Animal Feeder on this pen.

- The babies will enter another chamber. Use an Animal Grower on this pen. Create an exit from this chamber through another Animal Baby Separator, but this time with an Adult Filter.

- Lasty, setup a third pen where newly grown adult animals will go. This is your killing chamber. Go ham. Literally.

quests.name: Deepfry the Dragons!
quests.description: Craft a Draconic Solar Panel! It can generate... wait for it... 262,144 RF/tick! Why would you need that much power anyway?!

quests.name: Draining the Sun
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel IV! It can generate a much more respectable 128 RF/tick. Without progressing further into other chapters, this is as far as you can get.

quests.name: Crops will LOVE this
quests.description: Create some Fertilizer with your Sewage Composter! You can use it as Bone Meal, Brown Dye, an input for the Plant Fertilizer Machine, or to create some Crystalline Brown Slime Ingots.

quests.name: No slowing down
quests.description: Craft a Speed Upgrade I & II from Tesla Core Lib! Up to 64 of these can be applied to Industrial Foregoing machines.

quests.name: Dark Steel to Dark Stone
quests.description: Craft some Darkstone from QuantumFlux!

quests.name: Almost like Plastic!
quests.description: Use your Rotary Condensentrator to turn Ethylene into Liquid Ethylene. Then feed it into your Pressurized Reaction Chamber along with Oxygen to create some HDPE Pellets!

quests.name: It's so enchanting
quests.description: Craft a Silk Quarry and a Fortune Quarry Shape Card. They are pretty self explanatory. You'll get either Silk Touched or Fortuned outputs from your Builder, when using these Shape Cards.

quests.name: Quantum-quantification
quests.description: Craft a quantity of 1 Quantum Disk. This is used as a crafting material later on.

quests.name: Items will do a pullup for you
quests.description: Progress into Actually Additions, then craft a QuantumFlux Item Magnet! This is one of the best early- to midgame Baubles! It requires no power and it has quite a strong magnetic field.

quests.name: No spawns? No problem!
quests.description:
Craft a Mega Torch from Torchmaster! You will need a full OpenBlocks Tanks of Energized Glowstone.

This prevents all natural hostile mob spawns in a shape of a cylinder with a 64 block range and 128 block height.

This torch WON'T prevent mobs spawning from Cursed Earth or other artificial methods like Spawners.

quests.name: To actually make it work...
quests.description:
Craft a Shape Card: Quarry! Select two corner of an area to mine and insert it into the Builder! Power up the Builder and you can use it as a Quarry now!

If you don't want to destroy the environment, enter the Deep Dark and mine out that dimension instead! The Deep Dark Portal should be craftable now.

quests.name: Your first Quarry!
quests.description:
Welcome to the age of "not being low on any material" anymore! Craft an RFTools Builder and a Shape Card. You can use this machine to build structures for you, but you can also use it as a Quarry, once you upgrade your Shape Card into a Shape Card: Quarry.

(Note that the Builder's recipe takes 2 Block Breakers and 2 Block Placers.)

Feed it power and place a Chest on top for outputs. Place a lever on the side to activate it (or any other Redstone activation component).

Route the items from the output chest into your storage system and process the ores automatically with your Pulverizers and Redstone Furnaces.

quests.name: They take up too mushroom!
quests.description: Craft a Spores Recreator! Provide it with any of the two vanilla Mushrooms and Water to create more!

quests.name: No more slow-motion potion
quests.description: Craft a Potion Brewer! It can automatically create all the vanilla types of Potions! You'll need some of them in large quantity later on, so I recommend automating this machine sooner than later.

quests.name: Pressure transfer
quests.description: Craft some Basic Pressurized Tubes to transfer Gases with!

quests.name: (L)Oremaster
quests.description:
Once upon a time, there was a village in the far west... They were in dire need of outside help, because they've been invaded by forces... Forces that cannot easily be defeated, because they outnumbered them. An expanding country tried to annex their lands and forcefully levy taxes on them. And they had no say in it!

The village elders came together one night to discuss matters... How could the repel the invasion!? Noone knew the answer. Until a wise young man budged in and whispered: "We have something... they don't have. Let's use it."

And indeed they did. They were masters of a technique noone far and wide has ever even thought of...! The masters of Ore Creation.

They used Darkstone and refined Graphite to give back mother nature what hath been taketh away.

They indeed had mother nature herself on their side. With this knowledge, they waited for troops from the invading country. They waited patiently until one day, knights have arrived from the distance. The sun barely came up, but they were ready nonetheless.

They asked for mother nature because they knew she would listen... And mother nature provided. She created a massive earthquake that shook the knights off their horses! They got so scared they never returned.

That day would later be called "The Origin of the Oregen" and be celebrated each year thereafter.

Come, embrace the knowledge of the villagers, and create some Graphite Ore to please mother nature!

The End

quests.name: More Solar than before!
quests.description: Craft 5 Efficiency and 5 Transfer Rate upgrades from Solar Flux Reborn! You can insert at most 20 Efficiency and 10 Transfer Rate Upgrades into 1 Solar Panel. 20 Efficiency Upgrades will double the power generation, and 10 Transfer Rate Upgrades will multiply the RF transfer rate by 2.5.

quests.name: Absorbing the Rays
quests.description: Craft 8 Tier 1 Solar Panels together for a Tier 2 Solar Panel! It generates an even more incredible 8 RF/tick.

quests.name: You'll LAVA this machine!
quests.description: Craft a Lava Fabricator! When provided with power, it'll simply create Lava! Though it uses a lot of RF, so pumping some hot stuff from the Nether might still be a better option for you.

quests.name: Sunrise surprise
quests.description: Craft a Solar Panel VI! It can generate 2,048 RF/tick! Wow!

quests.name: Powered by the Sun
quests.description: Craft a Tier 1 Solar Panel from Solar Flux Reborn! It can generate an incredible 1 RF/tick in the daytime.

quests.name: Even sediment can be useful
quests.description: Craft an Animal Sewer and a Sewage Composter! Place an Animal on top of the Sewer and route the resulting Sewage into your Composter to create some Fertilizer.

quests.name: Faster than the London Tube
quests.description: Upgrade your Pressized Tubes all the way to the Ultimate variant! They can transfer slightly over 4 Buckets of Gas per tick, or over 80 Buckets per second!
